name: Juglans cinerea
Relationship: Compare: JUGLANDIN (duodenal catarrh; bilious diarrhoea); CHELIDON.; BRYON.; IRIS.

Head: Dull, full head
Eruption on scalp
SHARP, OCCIPITAL HEADACHE
Head feels enlarged
Pustules on lids and around eyes
Stomach: Atonic dyspepsia with much eructations and flatulent distention
Stool: Yellowish-green, with tenesmus and burning at anus
Back: Pain between scapula and under right
Mouth: Acrid feeling in mouth and throat
Soreness in region of tonsils externally
Dryness of root of tongue and fauces
Nose: Coryza, preceded by PAIN UNDER STERNUM, with threatening suffocation
Later, copious, bland, thick mucous discharge
Skin: Jaundice, with pain about liver and right scapula
Eczema, especially on lower extremities, sacrum and hands

details: A faulty elimination that produces jaundice and various skin eruptions, is pictured by this drug. The sharp, OCCIPITAL HEADACHE, usually associated with liver disturbance, is very characteristic. Pain in chest, axilla and scapula, with suffocative sensation. Feeling as if all internal organs were too large, especially those of left side. Cholelithiasis.
